title: Ticket #7167: Support multiple slurm clusters in the blahp
description:
Slurm supports a multi-cluster configuration, where multiple clusters share a slurmDBD and submitters can target any of the clusters from any submit machine. We should have first-class support for this setup in HTCondor's grid universe. A user submitting a grid universe job (grid-type batch slurm) should be able to specify which Slurm cluster to use.

We can do this fairly easily by extending the syntax of the existing batch_queue submit parameter. We'd allow an optional @ character followed by the cluster name, like so: 

# Submit to partition named debug on cluster2
batch_queue = debug@cluster2

# Submit to the default partition on cluster2
batch_queue = @cluster2

No changes would be required in the blahp, except in the slurm-specific shell scripts. When an alternate cluster name is specified, the job id generated by the submit script would the same @clustername suffix. This allows the other scripts to target the correct cluster.
